decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by countering opponents spells, removing their threats and generating card advantage. It incorporates a mix of removal, counterspells, creatures with value ETB effects, and powerful finishers to outlast and outmaneuver opponents. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while establishing a strong board presence with powerful threats like Celestial Colonnade and Restoration Angel. With efficient card draw and versatile answers, this deck is designed to adapt to different matchups and situations to ultimately come out on top through careful planning and strategic decision-making.

This deck aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruption spells. It focuses on using efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Terminate to control the board while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while cards like Liliana of the Veil provide additional disruption and pressure. Overall, the deck seeks to apply constant pressure while disrupting the opponent's resources.

This deck focuses on assembling the Twin combo of Splinter Twin and Deceiver Exarch/Pestermite to create infinite creature tokens and win the game. The deck includes a mix of card draw, counterspells, and removal to protect the combo pieces and disrupt opponent's strategies. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by recasting key spells from the graveyard. The deck aims to control the board until it can safely assemble the combo and close out the game in a single turn.

This deck utilizes the Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling combo to tutor and play various creatures with powerful abilities. It focuses on generating value through creatures with enter the battlefield effects, such as Restoration Angel and Wall of Roots. The deck also includes cards like Voice of Resurgence and Spellskite to disrupt opponents' strategies. The key strategy is to use Birthing Pod to sacrifice lower converted mana cost creatures and search for higher value creatures, ultimately assembling a combo to win the game.

The deck focuses on using creatures with enter-the-battlefield abilities to create a toolbox of options for various situations. By using cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the deck can tutor for specific creatures to deal with threats or advance its game plan. The combo pieces such as Melira, Sylvok Outcast, Kitchen Finks, and Viscera Seer can create infinite life or damage loops. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay to control the game and protect its combo. Lastly, the deck utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Birds of Paradise and Noble Hierarch to ramp into its powerful creatures quickly.

The main idea of this deck is to maintain control on the board while quickly dealing damage to the opponent by using cheap spells and creature abilities. The deck focuses on tempo plays, utilizing cards like Remand and Cryptic Command to disrupt the opponent's strategy while also generating value with cards like Young Pyromancer and Snapcaster Mage. By efficiently managing resources and creating a steady stream of threats, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. The land base is optimized for casting spells quickly and consistently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to generate a large amount of mana. This enables the player to cast powerful spells and control the board with counterspells, bounce effects, and removal. The deck also aims to tutor powerful artifacts such as Wurmcoil Engine, Mindslaver, and Solemn Simulacrum to further solidify its control over the game. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Academy Ruins for added recursion and versatility.

The main concept of this deck is to use the infect ability to quickly reduce your opponent's life total to 10 poison counters or less. This is achieved by playing low-cost creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, and then buffing them with pump spells like Groundswell and Mutagenic Growth. The deck also includes protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Pact of Negation to ensure your creatures can get through without being countered. Wild Defiance boosts your creatures and makes them more resilient, while Viridian Corrupter provides a way to deal with problematic artifacts.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game through denial and removal while ramping up mana to quickly play powerful threats such as Wurmcoil Engine, Karn Liberated, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to assemble Tron early in the game, allowing for the quick deployment of these threats. It also includes cards like Relic of Progenitus and Oblivion Stone to disrupt opponents' strategies and maintain control over the board. The deck aims to overpower opponents with its high-impact threats and efficient control elements.

This deck focuses on using Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling to tutor for specific creatures to create powerful combos and control the board. The toolbox of creatures includes various utility creatures like Spike Feeder, Sin Collector, and Spellskite, along with combo pieces like Murderous Redcap and Kitchen Finks. The deck aims to establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Abrupt Decay. Gavony Township provides additional value by pumping up the team of creatures.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disruption and efficient creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines hand disruption cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Tarmogoyf to control the board while deploying threats like Dark Confidant and Courser of Kruphix. The deck also includes powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil for additional disruption and card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on using Birthing Pod to tutor for specific creatures to create powerful combos and control the board. It utilizes creatures with enter the battlefield effects or abilities that can be repeatedly activated to generate value or disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to toolbox its creatures to assemble game-winning combos or lock opponents out of the game using cards like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Kitchen Finks to gain incremental advantage. The deck also includes disruption elements like Linvala, Keeper of Silence to shut down opponent's strategies.

This deck focuses on assembling all three Urza's lands to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing for powerful late-game plays. It uses a variety of control elements such as Pyroclasm and Oblivion Stone to manage the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Ulamog, and Emrakul to close out the game once the Tron lands are assembled. Card draw and tutoring effects help find the pieces needed to establish a dominant position in the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly gain life and utilize creatures that benefit from life gain to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Martyr of Sands, Soul Warden, and Serra Ascendant to gain life, and cards like Ajani's Pridemate and Spectral Procession to capitalize on that life gain, this deck aims to create a fast and potent aggro strategy that can quickly close out games before the opponent has a chance to establish their own game plan.

The main objective of this deck is to assemble the combo of Splinter Twin and either Pestermite or Deceiver Exarch to create an infinite combo that produces an infinite number of creature tokens with haste. This combo allows the player to quickly overwhelm the opponent and win the game. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Cryptic Command, Mana Leak, and Remand to control the game and protect the combo pieces until they can be assembled. With efficient card draw and removal spells, the deck aims to quickly set up the combo and secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing creature-based combo interactions to generate value and disrupt opponent's strategies. By utilizing cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the deck can tutor for specific creatures to assemble powerful combos or answer threats. Cards like Kitchen Finks, Spike Feeder, and Melira, Sylvok Outcast help to gain incremental advantage or protect against common removal strategies. The deck aims to outvalue opponents by effectively toolboxing creatures and creating advantageous board states through synergistic interactions.
